title: Social Studies Language Learning Competency Enhancement Program Using Digital Textbooks

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary social studies concepts, basic digital device proficiency, and foundational grammar/vocabulary comprehension
context.additional_context: Digital textbook utilization methods for pre-service elementary teachers to enhance social studies instructional competence. Content optimized for smartphone-based learning environments with integrated language learning components (reading comprehension, writing, expression).

learning_goals: Learners design ≥3 integrated reading-writing activities (50 minutes each) using audio, image, and video elements from social studies digital textbooks, and submit lesson plans achieving ≥4.0 (5-point scale) on peer-reviewed rubrics.
Learners acquire competency in evaluating digital textbook effectiveness based on the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) and strengthen social studies text analysis skills.
Project-based assessments demonstrate ≥35% improvement in learner engagement and language expression evaluation.

Learners create ≥1 digital language textbook operational on smartphones (iOS/Android), fulfill ≥3 of 4 production stages (planning-design-testing-deployment) via checklist criteria, and implement content reflecting vocabulary and grammar elements.

resources: Pre-made social studies digital sample textbook
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
